problem_names:
lemma laplace_transform_zero:\<comment> \<open>should also work for piecewise continuous\<close>
  assumes cont_f: "continuous_on {0..} f"
  assumes eo: "exponential_order M a f"
  assumes laplace: "\<And>s. Re s > a \<Longrightarrow> (f has_laplace 0) s"
  assumes "t \<ge> 0"
  shows "f t = 0"

lemma exponential_order_eventually_eq: "exponential_order M a f"
  if "exponential_order M a g" "\<And>t. t \<ge> k \<Longrightarrow> f t = g t"

lemma exponential_order_mono:
  assumes eo: "exponential_order M a f"
  assumes "a \<le> b" "M \<le> N"
  shows "exponential_order N b f"

lemma exponential_order_uminus_iff:
  "exponential_order M a (\<lambda>x. - f x) = exponential_order M a f"

lemma exponential_order_add:
  assumes "exponential_order M a f" "exponential_order M a g"
  shows "exponential_order (2 * M) a (\<lambda>x. f x + g x)"

theorem laplace_transform_unique:
  assumes f: "\<And>s. Re s > a \<Longrightarrow> (f has_laplace F) s"
  assumes g: "\<And>s. Re s > b \<Longrightarrow> (g has_laplace F) s"
  assumes [continuous_intros]: "continuous_on {0..} f"
  assumes [continuous_intros]: "continuous_on {0..} g"
  assumes eof: "exponential_order M a f"
  assumes eog: "exponential_order N b g"
  assumes "t \<ge> 0"
  shows "f t = g t"
translations:
lemma laplace_transform_zero:\<comment> \<open>should also work for piecewise continuous\<close>
  assumes cont_f: "continuous_on {0..} f"
  assumes eo: "exponential_order M a f"
  assumes laplace: "\<And>s. Re s > a \<Longrightarrow> (f has_laplace 0) s"
  assumes "t \<ge> 0"
  shows "f t = 0"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f t = 0
proof -

proof (state)

 1. f t = 0
define I where "I \<equiv> \<lambda>s k. integral {0..k} (laplace_integrand f s)"

proof (state)
this:
  I \<equiv> \<lambda>s k. integral {0..k} (laplace_integrand f s)

have bounded_image: "bounded (f ` {0..b})" for b

this:

apply atomize_elim

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>B. \<forall>b. \<forall>x\<in>{0..b}. cmod (f x) \<le> B b

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):

using bounded_image[unfolded bounded_iff]

proof (prove)
using this:

goal (1 subgoal):

this:

          has_integral
            integral {exp (- 0)..exp (- b)} ?i - integral {exp (- b)..exp (- 0)} ?i) {0..b}"

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. ((\<lambda>x.
         - exp (- x) *\<^sub>R
         exp (- x) ^ n *\<^sub>R
         (complex_of_real (exp (- x) powr s0) *
          f (- ln (exp (- x))))) has_integral
     integral {exp (- 0)..exp (- b)}
      (\<lambda>u.
          u ^ n *\<^sub>R (complex_of_real (u powr s0) * f (- ln u))) -
     integral {exp (- b)..exp (- 0)}
      (\<lambda>u.

lemma exponential_order_mono:
  assumes eo: "exponential_order M a f"
  assumes "a \<le> b" "M \<le> N"
  shows "exponential_order N b f"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. exponential_order N b f
proof (rule exponential_orderI)

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. 0 < N
 2. \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (f t) \<le> N * exp (b * t)
from exponential_orderD[OF eo] assms(3)

proof (chain)
picking this:
  0 < M
  \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (f t) \<le> M * exp (a * t)
  M \<le> N
show "0 < N"

proof (prove)
using this:
  0 < M
  \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (f t) \<le> M * exp (a * t)
  M \<le> N

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. 0 < N
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  0 < N

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (f t) \<le> N * exp (b * t)
have "\<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. (t::real) > 0"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. eventually ((<) 0) at_top
by (simp add: eventually_gt_at_top)

proof (state)
this:
  eventually ((<) 0) at_top

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (f t) \<le> N * exp (b * t)
then

proof (chain)
picking this:
  eventually ((<) 0) at_top
have "\<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. M * exp (a * t) \<le> N * exp (b * t)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  eventually ((<) 0) at_top

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. M * exp (a * t) \<le> N * exp (b * t)

by eventually_elim
      (use \<open>0 < N\<close> in \<open>force intro: mult_mono assms\<close>)

proof (state)
this:
  \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. M * exp (a * t) \<le> N * exp (b * t)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (f t) \<le> N * exp (b * t)
with exponential_orderD(2)[OF eo]

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (f t) \<le> M * exp (a * t)
  \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. M * exp (a * t) \<le> N * exp (b * t)
show "\<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (f t) \<le> N * exp (b * t)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (f t) \<le> M * exp (a * t)
  \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. M * exp (a * t) \<le> N * exp (b * t)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (f t) \<le> N * exp (b * t)
by (eventually_elim) simp

proof (state)
this:
  \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (f t) \<le> N * exp (b * t)

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

lemma exponential_order_uminus_iff:
  "exponential_order M a (\<lambda>x. - f x) = exponential_order M a f"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. exponential_order M a (\<lambda>x. - f x) = exponential_order M a f
by (auto simp: exponential_order_def)

lemma exponential_order_add:
  assumes "exponential_order M a f" "exponential_order M a g"
  shows "exponential_order (2 * M) a (\<lambda>x. f x + g x)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. exponential_order (2 * M) a (\<lambda>x. f x + g x)
using assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  exponential_order M a f
  exponential_order M a g

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. exponential_order (2 * M) a (\<lambda>x. f x + g x)
apply (auto simp: exponential_order_def)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>\<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top.
                norm (g t) \<le> M * exp (a * t);
     0 < M;
     \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top.
        norm (f t) \<le> M * exp (a * t)\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top.
                         norm (f t + g t) \<le> 2 * M * exp (a * t)
subgoal premises prems

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top.
       norm (f t + g t) \<le> 2 * M * exp (a * t)
using prems(1,3)

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (g t) \<le> M * exp (a * t)
  \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top. norm (f t) \<le> M * exp (a * t)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>\<^sub>F t in at_top.
       norm (f t + g t) \<le> 2 * M * exp (a * t)
apply (eventually_elim)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>t.
       \<lbrakk>norm (g t) \<le> M * exp (a * t);
        norm (f t) \<le> M * exp (a * t)\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> norm (f t + g t) \<le> 2 * M * exp (a * t)
apply (rule norm_triangle_le)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>t.
       \<lbrakk>norm (g t) \<le> M * exp (a * t);
        norm (f t) \<le> M * exp (a * t)\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> norm (f t) + norm (g t) \<le> 2 * M * exp (a * t)
by linarith

proof (prove)
goal:
No subgoals!
done

theorem laplace_transform_unique:
  assumes f: "\<And>s. Re s > a \<Longrightarrow> (f has_laplace F) s"
  assumes g: "\<And>s. Re s > b \<Longrightarrow> (g has_laplace F) s"
  assumes [continuous_intros]: "continuous_on {0..} f"
  assumes [continuous_intros]: "continuous_on {0..} g"
  assumes eof: "exponential_order M a f"
  assumes eog: "exponential_order N b g"
  assumes "t \<ge> 0"
  shows "f t = g t"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f t = g t
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f t = g t
define c where "c = max a b"

proof (state)
this:
  c = max a b

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f t = g t
define L where "L = max M N"

proof (state)
this:
  L = max M N

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f t = g t
from eof

proof (chain)
picking this:
  exponential_order M a f
have eof: "exponential_order L c f"

proof (prove)
using this:
  exponential_order M a f

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. exponential_order L c f
by (rule exponential_order_mono) (auto simp: L_def c_def)

proof (state)
this:
  exponential_order L c f

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f t = g t
from eog

proof (chain)
picking this:
  exponential_order N b g
have eog: "exponential_order L c (\<lambda>x. - g x)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  exponential_order N b g

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. exponential_order L c (\<lambda>x. - g x)
unfolding exponential_order_uminus_iff

proof (prove)
using this:
  exponential_order N b g

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. exponential_order L c g
by (rule exponential_order_mono) (auto simp: L_def c_def)

proof (state)
this:
  exponential_order L c (\<lambda>x. - g x)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f t = g t
from exponential_order_add[OF eof eog]

proof (chain)
picking this:
  exponential_order (2 * L) c (\<lambda>x. f x + - g x)
have eom: "exponential_order (2 * L) c (\<lambda>x. f x - g x)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  exponential_order (2 * L) c (\<lambda>x. f x + - g x)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. exponential_order (2 * L) c (\<lambda>x. f x - g x)
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  exponential_order (2 * L) c (\<lambda>x. f x - g x)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f t = g t
have l0: "((\<lambda>x. f x - g x) has_laplace 0) s" if "Re s > c" for s

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. ((\<lambda>x. f x - g x) has_laplace 0) s
using has_laplace_minus[OF f g, of s] that

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<lbrakk>a < Re s; b < Re s\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> ((\<lambda>x. f x - g x) has_laplace F - F) s
  c < Re s

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. ((\<lambda>x. f x - g x) has_laplace 0) s
by (simp add: c_def max_def split: if_splits)

proof (state)
this:
  c < Re ?s \<Longrightarrow> ((\<lambda>x. f x - g x) has_laplace 0) ?s

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f t = g t
have "f t - g t = 0"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f t - g t = 0

by (rule laplace_transform_zero[OF _ eom l0 \<open>t \<ge> 0\<close>])
      (auto intro!: continuous_intros)

proof (state)
this:
  f t - g t = 0

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f t = g t
then

proof (chain)
picking this:
  f t - g t = 0
show ?thesis

proof (prove)
using this:
  f t - g t = 0

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f t = g t
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  f t = g t

goal:
No subgoals!
qed
end
